meanings.definition: Of or concerned with the actual doing or use of something rather than with theory or ideas.
meanings.sent1: She chose a practical approach to fixing the broken chair by using glue.
meanings.sent2: It is practical to bring an umbrella when the weather forecast predicts rain.
meanings.sent3: The practical solution to the puzzle was to turn the piece around.
meanings.sent4: Her practical advice on saving money was like finding a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The practical demonstration of the experiment made it easy to understand.

meanings.definition: Likely to succeed or be effective in real circumstances; feasible.
meanings.sent1: Wearing comfortable shoes is practical for a long walk.
meanings.sent2: Having a backup plan is practical in case things don't go as expected.
meanings.sent3: It was practical to bring a map on the hike, but they ended up getting lost.
meanings.sent4: Her practical suggestion to improve sales was like a light bulb turning on.
meanings.sent5: The practical solution to the problem saved them a lot of time and effort.

meanings.definition: Sensible and realistic in approach or manner.
meanings.sent1: He made a practical decision to buy a used car instead of a brand new one.
meanings.sent2: It's practical to wear a helmet while riding a bike for safety.
meanings.sent3: The practical joke they played on him was harmless and funny.
meanings.sent4: Her practical advice on time management was a lifesaver during exams.
meanings.sent5: The practical choice of paint color made the room feel brighter and more spacious.
